isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - Driver Controlled Main Differential Lock - checking the Differential Lock

step1.para: Shift the vehicle transmission to neutral and start the engine to get the system air pressure to the normal level.

warning.para: Do not start the vehicle engine and engage the transmission with one wheel raised from the floor. When the differential is in locked (engaged) position, power will go to the wheel on the floor and cause the vehicle to move and cause serious personal injury.

step1.para: Put the differential lock switch (in the cab of the vehicle) in the unlocked (disengaged) position.
Drive the vehicle at 5 to 10 MPH (8 to 16 kph) and check the differential lock indicator light. The light must be off when the switch is in the unlocked position.

Continue to drive the vehicle and put the differential lock switch in the locked (engaged) position. Let up on the accelerator to remove the driveline torque and permit the shift. The light must be on when the switch is in the locked position.

note.para: If the indicator light remains on with the switch in the unlocked position, the differential is still in the locked position. Check to make sure that the manual engaging bolt was removed from the cylinder cover of the actuator assembly.
